info.title: Pages
info.description: Use these endpoints for interacting with Landing Pages and Site Pages
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: After noticing that a website page was updated incorrectly, use the API to view revisions of that page, then restore the page to a previous version.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the pages API to create and manage website pages.

get.summary: Retrieves a previous version of a Site Page
get.description: Retrieves a previous version of a Site Page

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Site Page id.

parameters.name: revisionId
parameters.description: The Site Page version id.

get.summary: Retrieves all the previous versions of a Landing Page
get.description: Retrieves all the previous versions of a Landing Page.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Landing Page id.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 100.

post.summary: Update a batch of Site Pages
post.description: Update the Site Page objects identified in the request body.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to update deleted Site Pages. Defaults to `false`.

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of the updated Site Pages.

get.summary: Retrieves all the previous versions of a Folder
get.description: Retrieves all the previous versions of a Folder.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Folder id.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 100.

post.summary: Restore a previous version of a Site Page
post.description: Takes a specified version of a Site Page and restores it.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Site Page id.

parameters.name: revisionId
parameters.description: The Site Page version id to restore.

get.description: Get the list of Landing Page Folders. Supports paging and filtering. This method would be useful for an integration that examined these models and used an external service to suggest edits.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Only return Folders created at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return Folders created after the specified time.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return Folders created before the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Only return Folders last updated at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only return Folders last updated after the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Only return Folders last updated before the specified time.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies which fields to use for sorting results. Valid fields are `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. `createdAt` will be used by default.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 100.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return deleted Folders. Defaults to `false`.

post.summary: Create a new Folder
post.description: Create a new Folder

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of a new Folder.

post.summary: Attach a site page to a multi-language group
post.description: Attach a site page to a multi-language group.

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of the AttachToLangPrimaryRequest object.

post.summary: Schedule a Site Page to be Published
post.description: Schedule a Site Page to be Published

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of the ContentScheduleRequestVNext object.

post.summary: Detach a site page from a multi-language group
post.description: Detach a site page from a multi-language group.

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of the DetachFromLangGroupRequest object.

post.summary: Create a batch of Folders
post.description: Create the Folder objects detailed in the request body.

requestBody.description: The JSON array of new Folders to create.

get.summary: Retrieves all the previous versions of a Site Page
get.description: Retrieves all the previous versions of a Site Page.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Site Page id.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 100.

get.summary: Retrieve the full draft version of the Landing Page
get.description: Retrieve the full draft version of the Landing Page.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Landing Page id.

patch.description:
Sparse updates the draft version of a single Landing Page object identified by the id in the path.
You only need to specify the column values that you are modifying.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Landing Page id.

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of the updated Landing Page to be applied to the draft.

get.description: Get the list of landing pages. Supports paging and filtering. This method would be useful for an integration that examined these models and used an external service to suggest edits.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Only return Landing Pages created at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return Landing Pages created after the specified time.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return Landing Pages created before the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Only return Landing Pages last updated at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only return Landing Pages last updated after the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Only return Landing Pages last updated before the specified time.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies which fields to use for sorting results. Valid fields are `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. `createdAt` will be used by default.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 100.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return deleted Landing Pages. Defaults to `false`.

post.description: Create a new Landing Page

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of a new Landing Page.

post.description: End an active A/B test and designate a winner.

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of the AbTestEndRequest object.

post.summary: Restore a previous version of a Site Page, to the draft version of the Site Page
post.description: Takes a specified version of a Site Page, sets it as the new draft version of the Site Page.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Site Page id.

parameters.name: revisionId
parameters.description: The Site Page version id to restore.

post.summary: Update a batch of Landing Pages
post.description: Update the Landing Page objects identified in the request body.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to update deleted Landing Pages. Defaults to `false`.

requestBody.description: The JSON representation of the updated Landing Pages.

Sparse updates the draft version of a single Site Page object identified by the id in the path.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The Folder id.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return deleted Folders. Defaults to `false`.

delete.description: Delete the Folder object identified by the id in the path.

parameters.description: The Folder id.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

Sparse updates a single Folder object identified by the id in the path.
You only need to specify the column values that you are modifying.

get.description: Get the list of site pages. Supports paging and filtering. This method would be useful for an integration that examined these models and used an external service to suggest edits.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Only return Site Pages created at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return Site Pages created after the specified time.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return Site Pages created before the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Only return Site Pages last updated at exactly the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only return Site Pages last updated after the specified time.

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Only return Site Pages last updated before the specified time.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies which fields to use for sorting results. Valid fields are `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. `createdAt` will be used by default.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 100.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return deleted Site Pages. Defaults to `false`.

post.summary: Delete a batch of Site Pages
post.description:
Delete the Site Page objects identified in the request body.
Note: This is not the same as the dashboard `archive` function. To perform a dashboard `archive` send an normal update with the `archivedInDashboard` field set to true.

requestBody.description: The JSON array of Site Page ids.

post.description: Create the Site Page objects detailed in the request body.

requestBody.description: The JSON array of new Site Pages to create.

BatchInputString.description: Wrapper for providing an array of strings as inputs.

primaryLanguage.description: Language of primary content to clone.

ContentLanguageCloneRequestVNext.description: Request body object for creating new language variant content.

StandardError.description: Model definition for a standard error.

BatchInputJsonNode.description: Wrapper for providing an array of JSON nodes as inputs.

BatchResponsePageWithErrors.description: Response object for batch operations on pages with errors.

languages.description: Map of object IDs to associated languages of object in the multi-language group.

primaryId.description: ID of the primary object in the multi-language group.

UpdateLanguagesRequestVNext.description: Request object for updating languages within a multi-language group.

id.description: ID of object to set as primary in multi-language group.

SetNewLanguagePrimaryRequestVNext.description: Request body object for setting a new primary language.

CollectionResponseWithTotalContentFolder.description: Response object for collections of content folders with pagination information.

RGBAColor.description: A color defined by RGB values.

id.description: ID of the object to remove from a multi-language group.

DetachFromLangGroupRequestVNext.description: Request body object for detaching objects from multi-language groups.

contentId.description: ID of the object to test.

AbTestCreateRequestVNext.description: Request body object for creating A/B tests.

publishDate.description: The date (ISO8601 format) the page is to be published at.

language.description: The explicitly defined ISO 639 language code of the page. If null, the page will default to the language of the Domain.

enableLayoutStylesheets.description: Boolean to determine whether or not the styles from the template should be applied.

metaDescription.description: A description that goes in <meta> tag on the page.

attachedStylesheets.description: List of stylesheets to attach to this page. These stylesheets are attached to just this page. Order of precedence is bottom to top, just like in the HTML.

password.description: Set this to create a password protected page. Entering the password will be required to view the page.

publishImmediately.description: Set this to true if you want to be published immediately when the schedule publish endpoint is called, and to ignore the publish_date setting.

htmlTitle.description: The html title of this page.

id.description: The unique ID of the page.

state.description: An ENUM descibing the current state of this page.

slug.description: The path of the this page. This field is appended to the domain to construct the url of this page.

createdById.description: The ID of the user that created this page.

archivedInDashboard.description: If True, the page will not show up in your dashboard, although the page could still be live.

contentTypeCategory.description: An ENUM descibing the type of this object. Should be either LANDING_PAGE or SITE_PAGE.

mabExperimentId.description: The ID of the MAB test (or dynamic test) associated with this page, if applicable

updatedById.description: The ID of the user that updated this page.

translatedFromId.description: ID of the primary page this object was translated from.

folderId.description: The ID of the associated folder this landing page is organized under in the app dashboard.

widgetContainers.description: A data structure containing the data for all the modules inside the containers for this page. This will only be populated if the page has widget containers.

pageExpiryRedirectId.description: The ID of another page this page's url should redirect to once this page expires. Should only set this or pageExpiryRedirectUrl.

authorName.description: The name of the user that updated this page.

domain.description: The domain this page will resolve to. If null, the page will default to the primary domain for this content type.

name.description: The internal name of the page.

dynamicPageHubDbTableId.description: The ID of the HubDB table this page references, if applicable

campaign.description: The GUID of the marketing campaign this page is a part of.

enableDomainStylesheets.description: Boolean to determine whether or not the styles from the template should be applied.

includeDefaultCustomCss.description: Boolean to determine whether or not the Primary CSS Files should be applied.

subcategory.description: Details the type of page this is. Should always be landing_page or site_page

footerHtml.description: Custom HTML for embed codes, javascript that should be placed before the </body> tag of the page.

widgets.description: A data structure containing the data for all the modules for this page.

headHtml.description: Custom HTML for embed codes, javascript, etc. that goes in the <head> tag of the page.

pageExpiryRedirectUrl.description: The URL this page's url should redirect to once this page expires. Should only set this or pageExpiryRedirectId.

abStatus.description: The status of the AB test associated with this page, if applicable

useFeaturedImage.description: Boolean to determine if this page should use a featuredImage.

abTestId.description: The ID of the AB test associated with this page, if applicable

pageExpiryEnabled.description: Boolean describing if the page expiration feature is enabled for this page

templatePath.description: String detailing the path of the template used for this page.

url.description: A generated field representing the URL of this page.

publicAccessRules.description: Rules for require member registration to access private content.

archivedAt.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when this page was deleted.

pageExpiryDate.description: The date at which this page should expire and begin redirecting to another url or page.

publicAccessRulesEnabled.description: Boolean to determine whether or not to respect publicAccessRules.

pageRedirected.description: A generated Boolean describing whether or not this page is currently expired and being redirected.

currentState.description: A generated ENUM descibing the current state of this page.

categoryId.description: ID of the type of object this is. Should always .

linkRelCanonicalUrl.description: Optional override to set the URL to be used in the rel=canonical link tag on the page.

Page.description: Model definition for a landing page or site page.

language.description: Designated language of the object to add to a multi-language group.

id.description: ID of the object to add to a multi-language group.

primaryId.description: ID of primary language object in multi-language group.

primaryLanguage.description: Primary language of the multi-language group.

AttachToLangPrimaryRequestVNext.description: Request body object fro attaching objects to multi-language groups.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

deletedAt.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when this content folder was deleted.

parentFolderId.description: The ID of the content folder this folder is nested under

name.description: The name of the folder which will show up in the app dashboard

id.description: The unique ID of the content folder.

category.description: The type of object this folder applies to. Should always be LANDING_PAGE.

ContentFolder.description: Model definition for a content folder.

BatchResponseContentFolder.description: Response object for successful batch operations on content folders.

CollectionResponseWithTotalPageForwardPa.description: Response object for collections of pages with pagination information.

total.description: Total number of content folder versions.

CollectionResponseWithTotalVersionConten.description: Response object for collections of content folder versions with pagination information.

VersionPage.description: Model definition for a landing page or site page version. Contains metadata describing the version of the page. It can be used to view edit history of a page.

BatchResponseContentFolderWithErrors.description: Response object for batch operations on content folders with errors.

fullName.description: First and last name of the user.

VersionUser.description: Model definition for a version user. Contains addition information about the user who created a version.

CollectionResponseWithTotalVersionPage.description: Response object for collections of page versions with pagination information.

BatchInputContentFolder.description: Wrapper for providing an array of content folders as inputs.

BatchResponsePage.description: Response object for successful batch operations on pages.

variationId.description: ID of the object to reactivate as a test variation.

abTestId.description: ID of the test to rerun.

AbTestRerunRequestVNext.description: Request body object for rerunning A/B tests.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate
message.example: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

winnerId.description: ID of the object to designate as the test winner.

abTestId.description: ID of the test to end.

AbTestEndRequestVNext.description: Request body object for ending A/B tests.

PreviousPage.description: Model definition for a previous page

BatchInputPage.description: Wrapper for providing an array of pages as inputs.

publishDate.description: The date the object should transition from scheduled to published.

id.description: The ID of the object to be scheduled.

ContentScheduleRequestVNext.description: Request body object for scheduling the publish of content

id.description: ID of the object to be cloned.

ContentCloneRequestVNext.description: Request body object for cloning content.

VersionContentFolder.description: Model definition for a content folder version. Contains metadata describing the version of the folder. It can be used to view edit history of a folder.

NextPage.description: Model definition for a next page.

scopes.content: Read from and write to my Content
